ranked_diseases.disease_name: COL4A1-related brain small vessel disease with hemorrhage
ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with cerebral hemorrhage, porencephalic cysts, hydrocephalus, dilated ventricles, and white matter abnormalities. COL4A1 mutations cause basement membrane defects leading to intracerebral hemorrhages and porencephaly.
Similar to COL4A1, presents with intracerebral hemorrhage, porencephalic cysts, and white matter changes. COL4A2 mutations affect the same collagen IV network in blood vessels.
Features basal ganglia calcification, white matter abnormalities, and cerebral atrophy. However, hemorrhage and porencephalic cysts are less typical.
Presents with intracranial calcifications, hydrocephalus, and white matter abnormalities mimicking congenital infections. Hemorrhage is possible but less prominent.
Characterized by basal ganglia calcification and can have associated neurological symptoms. However, lacks the hemorrhagic and cystic features seen in this patient.
Features cerebral calcifications, white matter abnormalities, and brain atrophy. Porencephalic cysts and hemorrhage are not typical features.
